metadata.title: CVE-2016-8289 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.13 and earlier allows localusers to affect integrity and availability via vectors related to Server:InnoDB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8289` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.15-0ubuntu2').
